title: My Current Pass Won't Work for My Thunderbird Account
content:
I recently had to update all my passwords for all my Thunderbird email accounts. It all seemed to go well. I was able to logon to all my email accounts, but just 2 days ago I wasn't able to logon to one of my secondary email accounts. 

I haven't been able to clearly understand just where my passwords are located, so does anyone have any suggestions on where to find my passwords?  I'm stuck....

title: version 128 64 bit
content:
One of my desktop computers with Windows 10 updated to version 128 64 bit.

But my newer desktop computer with Windows 11 updated to version 128 32 bit.

Makes no sense.

Looks like Thunderbird never updated their software to be able to hide select folders which I have been asking for over a year. Even the old Windows Live Mail had this feature form 2011.

creator: gsw56570

title: Cannot connect to Telstra / Bigpond server (IMAP): "Unable to login at server.  Probably wrong configuration, username or password"
content:
I have an IMAP email account with Telstra (Bigpond). SSL/TLS is set for Thunderbird account server and smtp. I have looked through lots of web messages without finding one on topic.

Via web browser I can connect to my Bigpond (Telstra) email without issue.

My Bigpond email will also not connect to Outlook, which was provided by my work which I left 3 weeks ago and this was happening on both my laptop and my mobile phone. Before August 2023, there was no problem and I could access my private Bigpond email account on both laptop and phone as added account in Outlook. One day in August 2023, Outlook started not connecting to my Bigpond email account both on my laptop and my phone. Telstra (Bigpond) told me last year that it was a Microsoft issue. Microsoft has denied this.

The fact that the same problem is happening when I want to add my Bigpond account to Thunderbird suggests it is not a problem with the email client (Outlook or Thunderbird) but either a Telstra or a local programme issue. I have Norton Antivirus, but I cannot see anything in that interfering with the email server connection.

I have tried re-setting my Bigpond webmail password and re-starting multiple times - no joy!
creator: cgprice

title: Cryptogroup email
content:
I had a cryptogroup email account on Mozilla Thunderbird for many years. Then quite suddenly it stopped working. I could get no information about why or what happened even long after it expired. It just went away.

I moved to another system. But I find myself in a legal battle that requires an email from that system. I have no way to access it since the server is no longer available. But I desperately need a copy of that email.

Is there any way I can get to those emails or to someone who can get to those emails and send me a copy of the email I am looking for?

Obviously this cryptogroup email will not work any longer. So any notifications sent to it will not get to me. So Please send any response to nvfree@proton.me.

Thank you.
creator: judy44

title: lost emails
content:
Good day

yesterday I had an issue with my new emails from 1st August to 5th August, they were not displaying correctly, so I did a repair folder to my inbox, once I did this and said OK all my current emails until May 2022 disappeared! Some emails received yesterday 5th August 2024 will not open and have lost their attachments. This only happened in my inbox... Why has this happened and please can someone help me get all these emails back.

creator: martin.ivanov.300733

title: Show all folders
content: I like to have all folders displayed - also if they are not 'subscribed'. The reason is that we have shared e-mail accounts and colleagues may create folders which I will not see until I know that I have to subscribe to the new folder. Every time I recognize this I do a Google search to find the checkbox 'Show only subscribed folders' and uncheck it. Would it be possible to put that in a more prominent place than 'Advanced...'? Or even better a global setting that all new accounts I connec inherit the setting "'Show only subscribed folders' unchecked".
creator: reiner.zorn
